thread.title: Costco shopper Derrick Gharabighi ‘punched elderly man over free Nutella samples’ in Burbank, California dailytelegraph.com.au
thread.title_full: Costco shopper Derrick Gharabighi ‘punched elderly man over free Nutella samples’ in Burbank, California | dailytelegraph.com.au

author: dailytelegraph.com
title: Costco shopper Derrick Gharabighi ‘punched elderly man over free Nutella samples’ in Burbank, California dailytelegraph.com.au
text:
A MAN could spend up to 11 years in jail for allegedly punching a 78-year-old Costco shopper in the face — over free Nutella samples.
Police said Derrick Gharabighi, 24, allegedly picked up all the samples at a Burbank California store on Sunday when Sahak Sahakian reached for one.
When Sahakian told the young man not to take so many, Gharabighi allegedly punched him in the face.
The senior citizen was hospitalised with a one-inch cut and swelling above his eye.
Lashed out ... Derrick Gharabighi, 24, allegedly punched an elderly man over a free Nutella sample. Picture: Instagram/babyface81869 Source: Supplied
“It’s a shame that it had to come to this over a Nutella sample,” Burbank Police Department Sgt. Claudio Losacco told KTLA.
“It’s a tragic situation where someone in their 70s, almost 80 years old, is faced with something like this.”
Gharabighi is being held on $US50,000 bail, county inmate records show, and faces court on October 2. He faces up to 11 years jail if found guilty of elder abuse.
Gharabighi has an extensive criminal record.
According to records, Sunday’s arrest was his fifth since December 2014. His most recent was two weeks ago.
In July, charges of felony spousal or cohabitant abuse and spousal battery were filed against him. The case is pending
He was convicted of possession of illegal drugs for sale and of petty theft in January, and had trespassing convictions in 2012 and 2013.
